column4: hello, i would like to know why each time i try open Azureus, it opens for a few seconds then just shuts down...
Applications -> Accessories -> Gnome Terminal              type in azureus and hit enter
you might have too look in ~/.azureus or ~/.azureus/log(s)
i tryied launching azureus again, and when it shut down, it said in the terminal: Aborted (core dumped)
go to /home/donald/.azureus and see if there are any .log files there
bash: /home/donald/.azureus: No such file or directory
whereever your home folder is lol
it doesnt find .azureus anywhere, i checked with the search app in every directory, and it doesnt find it :s
its a hidden directory at the base of a users home folder
so how do i access it?
